intro: Oliganthes lecomtei, commonly known as the Lecomte's oliganthes, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence, which is typical of the genus Oliganthes. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a cool, temperate climate to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oliganthes lecomtei is considered a species of conservation concern.
